public class Bank extends Object implements Serializable

  • Constructor Details

    • Bank

      public Bank(int yellowGood, int redGood, int greenGood, int blueGood, int battery)
      Constructs a new Bank instance with the specified quantities of goods and batteries.
      Parameters:
      yellowGood - the quantity of yellow goods to initialize the bank with
      redGood - the quantity of red goods to initialize the bank with
      greenGood - the quantity of green goods to initialize the bank with
      blueGood - the quantity of blue goods to initialize the bank with
      battery - the quantity of batteries to initialize the bank with

  • Method Details

    • addGood

      public void addGood(Goods good)
      Adds a good to the bank and increments the corresponding counter based on the value of the good.
      Parameters:
      good - The good to be added. Its value determines which type of good (red, yellow, green, or blue) will have its count incremented.

    • getYellowGood

      public int getYellowGood()
      Retrieves the current quantity of yellow goods stored.
      Returns:
      the number of yellow goods available

    • getRedGood

      public int getRedGood()
      Retrieves the amount of red goods currently available. This method provides access to the internal state of the red goods count.
      Returns:
      the current quantity of red goods

    • getGreenGood

      public int getGreenGood()
      Retrieves the value of the green goods stored.
      Returns:
      the integer value representing the quantity of green goods.

    • getBlueGood

      public int getBlueGood()
      Retrieves the current value of blue goods.
      Returns:
      the number of blue goods available

    • addGoodsFromList

      public void addGoodsFromList(List<Goods> goodL)
      Adds a list of goods to the current inventory by categorizing them based on their value. Updates the counts for different types of goods (red, yellow, green, blue) based on the value property of each good.
      Parameters:
      goodL - the list of goods to be added; each good is categorized by its value (4 for red, 3 for yellow, 2 for green, 1 for blue)

    • addBattery

      public void addBattery(int battery)
      Adds the specified amount of battery to the existing battery count.
      Parameters:
      battery - the amount of battery to add

    • useGood

      public void useGood(Goods good)
      Uses a specific type of good based on its value. Determines the type of good to use (red, yellow, green, or blue) by evaluating the value of the provided Goods object and calls the corresponding private method.
      Parameters:
      good - the Goods object containing the value that determines the type of good to use

    • useBattery

      public void useBattery(int numBattery)
      Consumes a specified amount of battery from the available battery in the bank. If the available battery is less than the specified amount, an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      numBattery - the amount of battery to consume
